abstract: An up-and-coming festival dedicated to Latin and African dance moves kicks off in Prague's Old Town on Nov. 2.
snippet: An up-and-coming festival dedicated to Latin and African dance moves kicks off in Prague's Old Town on Nov. 2.
lead_paragraph: An up-and-coming festival dedicated to Latin and African dance moves kicks off in Prague's Old Town on Nov. 2. Heading into its second year, the Afro-Bailar Festival is taking over the Latin dance club Palanca on the fifth floor of the newly renovated Kotva department store (Namesti Republiky 8; www.palanca.cz), with a solid offering of international dance performances and workshops. There will be a little of everything, from salsa, reggae and tango to the sweet rhythmic beats of Africa's popular kizomba, mbalax and semba music.

headline.main: African and Latin Beats at Prague Festival
